intro: Trianosperma angustilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed trianosperma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical classification places it within the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
